description: Vance has faced repeated questions on the campaign trail about whether Trump lost in 2020. On Wednesday, he gave his most direct answer to date, answering "no" in response to a reporter's question.
title: JD Vance says 'no,' he does not think Trump lost in 2020

description: The judge, Reed O’Connor, in Fort Worth, Tex., has rejected calls for him to step down from the high-profile case Musk filed against Media Matters, a watchdog group.
title: New records show Texas judge on X case didn't sell his Tesla shares after taking the suit

description: The interview was the vice president's first formal sit-down with Fox. She faced questions on immigration, and was given a chance to answer again what she would do differently from President Biden.
title: Harris interview on Fox gets testy -- but also gives her a do-over

description: Justice Clarence Thomas dissented while two other conservatives wrote that they may be sympathetic to the case were it to be brought after a lower court ruling.
title: Supreme Court refuses to interfere in EPA litigation, for now

description: The Biden administration has urged Israel to conduct credible, transparent investigations into the Americans' deaths, so far Israel has not prosecuted anyone. We hear from families of those killed, and a member of congress, who think the U.S. Justice Department should be doing more.
title: Four Americans allegedly killed by Israeli forces, why isn't the U.S. investigating?

description: Nebraska’s highest court ruled against top state officials as it upheld a law providing felons with a path to register to vote after completing their sentences.
title: Nebraska Supreme Court clears the way for people with felony convictions to vote

description: Robert Telles, a former Las Vegas-area official, was sentenced for killing Jeff German, who wrote articles critical of his conduct in office and exposed an intimate relationship with a coworker.
title: Former county official gets at least 28 years in prison for killing Las Vegas reporter

description: In one refugee settlement in Chad, estimates are that 97% of the Sudanese residents are women and children. Here's how four women there are mourning the loss of a partner and struggling to get by.
title: A world of women: Portraits from a refugee camp where the men are missing

description: A judge temporarily blocked Alabama’s voter removal program after finding the state violated federal law by systematically purging voters too close to this fall’s election.
title: A federal judge has ordered Alabama to stop trying to purge voters before Election Day

description: Over 11 million pounds of ready-to-eat meat and poultry were recalled over listeria concerns, affecting salads, wraps, frozen meals and more from popular chains like Target, Trader Joe's and Walmart.
title: Millions of pounds of meat are being recalled. Here's what to look for in your fridge

description: Over 11 million pounds of ready-to-eat meat and poultry were recalled over listeria concerns, affecting salads, wraps, frozen meals and more from popular chains like Target, Trader Joe's and Walmart.
title: Millions of pounds of meat are being recalled. Here's what to look for in your fridge

description: The former president took questions on immigration, the economy and abortion in the hour-long town hall in front of a friendly crowd of women in suburban Atlanta.
title: Trump focuses on women's issues in front of all-woman audience in Fox News town hall

description: Historian Mary Ziegler talks about the legal battles shaping reproductive rights across the U.S. — including the scope of abortion access and the fate of invitro-fertilization.
title: Where do things stand with reproductive rights as we head into the election?

description: The seven-time Super Bowl champion purchased a minority stake in the Las Vegas Raiders, a deal unanimously approved by NFL team owners at the league's annual fall meeting.
title: Tom Brady is now a part owner of the Las Vegas Raiders

description: More than 140 people, including children, were killed and dozens were injured after an overturned tanker truck exploded in flames while they were trying to scoop up fuel pouring from the vehicle.
title: More than 140 people die and dozens are injured in a Nigeria gasoline tanker explosion

description: The Biden administration has taken significant steps to address the medical debt problem that burdens 100 million people in America, but gains would be jeopardized by a Trump win, advocates say.
title: Harris backs slashing medical debt. Trump’s ‘concepts’ worry advocates

description: Six techniques to energize you when you feel sluggish and relax you when you feel stressed. Feel the transformation in 15 minutes or less.
title: COMIC: Science-backed mood boosters to (almost instantly) snap you out of a funk

description: America’s biggest pharmacy chains are closing hundreds of stores, laying off thousands of workers and rethinking their role in our lives.
title: CVS and Walgreens are ailing. Here’s why

description: A new trove of letters and oral histories is shining a light on the successes and challenges of jailhouse lawyers: people in prison who help themselves and others navigate the legal system.
title: 'Cheat Code to Life': Jailhouse lawyers help incarcerated people—and themselves, too

description: The Treasury in Petra, Jordan, is a famous tourist site and features in an Indiana Jones movie. Now archaeologists say they've found a remarkable 12 complete skeletons in a hidden tomb beneath it.
title: Archaeologists discover 12 skeletons at a buried tomb in Petra, Jordan

description: A recently televised documentary in Spain rekindles competing versions of the famed explorer's origins, but the scientific community is viewing it with caution.
title: Christopher Columbus may have been a Spanish Jew, according to a new documentary

description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries is campaigning in competitive districts across the U.S. with the goal of flipping control of the House of Representatives in the November election.
title: Hakeem Jeffries could be the first Black speaker of the House. First, he needs to win

description: The polling averages show Vice President Kamala Harris’ lead has dropped in every swing state in recent weeks.
title: Swing state map: Polls move in Trump’s direction, but the race remains tight

description: The SBA’s disaster loan program has run out of money, it announced on Tuesday. The agency expects to receive new funding from Congress, and will continue to accept applications in the meantime.
title: Small business disaster loan program is out of money until new funds are approved

description: Ukraine says North Korean military engineers have been sent to Russia to check how well missiles are launching.
title: Ukraine says North Korea is sending soldiers to help Russia in the war

description: We travel to the swing state of Michigan — in order to speak to some of the most influential and misunderstood voters in the country: Arab Americans in Dearborn. The Dearbornites we met said that the war in Gaza is the key issue on their minds as they consider how to cast their ballots. What these voters ultimately decide could have huge consequences for the whole country.
title: In Michigan, Arab Americans weigh the power of a vote

description: Survivors of last year's deadly wildfire that decimated a historic Maui town will receive an additional year of housing assistance from the Federal Emergency Management Agency.
title: Maui wildfire survivors will get an additional year of housing help from FEMA

description: The Pentagon said more than 800 military personnel have seen their records upgraded to honorable discharges after being kicked out of the military under its former “don’t ask, don’t tell” policy.
title: Pentagon to give honorable discharges to some kicked out from 'don't ask, don't tell'
